title:
NACC Uniform Data Set (UDS) - FOLLOW-UP VISIT PACKET - FORM B5: BEHAVIORAL ASSESSMENT -
 Inventory Questionnaire (NPI-Q [1])
description: INSTRUCTIONS: This form is to be completed by the clinician or other trained health professional based onco-participant interview, as described by the training video. (This is not to be completed by the subject as apaper-and-pencil self-report.) For information on NPI-Q Interviewer Certification, see UDS Coding Guidebook forFollow-up Visit Packet, Form B5. Link to NACC Coding GuidebookCheck only one box for each category of response.CORRECTED INSTRUCTIONS: Please answer the following questions based on changes that have occurred since thepatient first began to experience memory (i.e. cognitive) problems. Select 1=Yes only if the symptom(s) has beenpresent in the last month. Otherwise, select 0=No.For each item marked 1=Yes, rate the SEVERITY of the symptom (how it affects the patient):1 = Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)2 = Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)3 = Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_npiqinfx.title: 1a If NPI CO-PARTICIPANT other-specify
fu_npiqinfx.description: (Any text or numbers with the exception of single quotes ('), double quotes ("), ampersands (&), and percentage signs (%).)

fu_del.title: 2a. Delusions - Does the patient have false beliefs, such as thinking that others are stealing from him/her or planning to harm him/her in some way?

fu_delsev.title: 2b. If Delusions, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_hall.title: 3a. Hallucinations - Does the patient have hallucinations such as false visions or voices? Does he or she seem to hear or see things that are not present?

fu_hallsev.title: 3b. If Hallucinations, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_agit.title: 4a. Agitation/aggression - Is the patient  resistive to help from others at times, or hard to handle?

fu_agitsev.title: 4b. If Agitation/agression, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_depd.title: 5a. Depression/dysphoria - Does the patient seem sad or say that he/she is depressed?

fu_depdsev.title: 5b. If Depression/dysphoria, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_anx.title: 6a. Anxiety - Does the patient become upset when separated from you? Does he/she have any other signs of nervousness, such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?

fu_anxsev.title: 6b. If Anxiety, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_elat.title: 7a. Elation/euphoria - Does the patient appear to feel too good or act excessively happy?

fu_elatsev.title: 7b. If Elation/euphoria, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_apa.title: 8a. Apathy/indifference - Does the patient seem less interested in his/her usual activities or in the activities and plans of others?

fu_apasev.title: 8b. If Apathy/indifference, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_disn.title: 9a. Disinhibition - Does the patient seem to act impulsively, for example, talking to strangers as if he/she knows them, or saying things that may hurt people's feelings?

fu_disnsev.title: 9b. If Disinhibition, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_irr.title: 10a. Irritability/lability - Is the patient impatient and cranky? Does he/she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?

fu_irrsev.title: 10b. If Irritability/lability, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_mot.title: 11a. Motor disturbance - Does the patient engage in repetitive activities such as pacing around the house, handling buttons, wrapping string, or doing other things repeatedly?

fu_motsev.title: 11b. If Motor disturbance, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_nite.title: 12a. Nighttime behaviors - Does the patient awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning, or take excessive naps during the day?

fu_nitesev.title: 12b. If Nighttime behaviors, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_app.title: 13a. Appetite/eating - Has the patient lost or gained weight, or had a change in the type of food he/she likes?

fu_appsev.title: 13b. If Appetite/eating, rate severity
enum: 1 Mild (noticeable, but not a significant change)
2 Moderate (significant, but not a dramatic change)
3 Severe (very marked or prominent, a dramatic change)

fu_del.title: 2a. Delusions - Does the patient have false beliefs, such as thinking that others are stealing from him/her or planning to harm him/her in some way?

fu_hall.title: 3a. Hallucinations - Does the patient have hallucinations such as false visions or voices? Does he or she seem to hear or see things that are not present?

fu_agit.title: 4a. Agitation/aggression - Is the patient  resistive to help from others at times, or hard to handle?

fu_depd.title: 5a. Depression/dysphoria - Does the patient seem sad or say that he/she is depressed?

fu_anx.title: 6a. Anxiety - Does the patient become upset when separated from you? Does he/she have any other signs of nervousness, such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?

fu_elat.title: 7a. Elation/euphoria - Does the patient appear to feel too good or act excessively happy?

fu_apa.title: 8a. Apathy/indifference - Does the patient seem less interested in his/her usual activities or in the activities and plans of others?

fu_disn.title: 9a. Disinhibition - Does the patient seem to act impulsively, for example, talking to strangers as if he/she knows them, or saying things that may hurt people's feelings?

fu_irr.title: 10a. Irritability/lability - Is the patient impatient and cranky? Does he/she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?

fu_mot.title: 11a. Motor disturbance - Does the patient engage in repetitive activities such as pacing around the house, handling buttons, wrapping string, or doing other things repeatedly?

fu_nite.title: 12a. Nighttime behaviors - Does the patient awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning, or take excessive naps during the day?

fu_app.title: 13a. Appetite/eating - Has the patient lost or gained weight, or had a change in the type of food he/she likes?
